situation: M started getting visibly upset during a reading exercise, unable to keep up with the text and falling behind the class.
action: The TA sat next to M and gently guided him through the reading passage, using a coloured overlay to help reduce visual stress. She praised M for the efforts and encouraged him by highlighting the parts he managed well. M felt reassured and was able to continue the exercise with less anxiety.
effect: M felt supported and managed to engage with the reading task more confidently. The TA's approach helped lessen his anxiety, allowing for increased participation. M completed the exercise with minimal frustration and gained a better understanding of the material.
